info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:55PM CDT until August 29 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON...SOUTHEASTERN LA SALLE AND SOUTHWESTERN GRUNDY COUNTIES... At 1255 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mazon to near Flanagan, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Streator, Pontiac, Marseilles, Seneca, Odell, South Streator, Grand Ridge, Cornell, Ransom, Kangley, Long Point, Verona and Kinsman. Including the following interstate... I-55 between mile markers 198 and 213. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for damaging winds and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
